item.title: Ranger - Show File in Path Finder
item.description: Ranger is a VIM-inspired filemanager for the console (https://ranger.github.io/) and can easily be installed by using brew install ranger. When working in the terminal sometimes it is nice to open the files in the default Finder app or use the excellent alternative called Path Finder. (https://cocoatech.com/#/) To reveal your files in the Finder or Path Finder create a commands.py in ~/.config/ranger and paste the following code. from ranger.api.commands import Command class show_files_in_path_finder(Command): """ :show_files_in_path_finder Present selected files in finder """ def execute(self): import subprocess files = ",".
